author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Bar Council of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry has cancelled the enrolment of an advocate, allegedly a ‘history-sheeter’ for suppressing the fact that there were a number of criminal cases pending against him at the time of enrolment.

S.R. Balasubramanian, a resident of Natham village in Dindigul district, who enrolled as an advocate before the State Bar Council on November 5, 2008 was found to be involved in various criminal activities and criminal charges under Sections 307 (Attempt to murder), 352 (assault), 506 (ii) (Criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code were said to be pending against him in the Natham Police Station.

Based on a complaint from S.M.K. Sheik Oli, Enrolment Committee of State Bar Council, headed by its Chairman A.A. Venkatesan, conducted an enquiry and ordered cancellation and removal of Balasubramanian’s name from the rolls. The lawyer has not disclosed the facts about the cases pending against him during enrolment. “Even after enrolment he got involved in many criminal cases and had been detained under the Goondas Act. He had intentionally... concealed the material factum at the time of enrolment.”

He was found to be involved in various

criminal activities and criminal charges under various IPC sections
title: TN Bar Council cancels enrolment of advocate
